items.question: What does OTC mean?
items.answer: OTC (over-the-counter) refers to private transactions executed directly between two parties — outside of public exchanges. Price, volume, and timing remain confidential.

items.question: Why trade OTC instead of on an exchange?
items.answer: Large orders on public exchanges cause slippage and price impact. OTC desks access deep liquidity pools, ensuring your trade moves the market zero — not against you.

items.question: Who uses OTC desks?
items.answer: High-net-worth individuals, family offices, funds, and institutions — anyone moving significant volume who values discretion, speed, and competitive pricing.

items.question: How is settlement handled?
items.answer: Trades settle same-day via bank transfer, cash, or direct crypto delivery. Each transaction is bespoke — structured around your preferences.
